result.execSummary:
The defendant Kari E. Geno was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

supervisions.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: 1:50 pm case called. Defendant Kari E. Geno in court with attorney William Michael Lennon.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Agreement reached and stated on the record.   Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: No Contest to Count 2.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Court dismisses and reads-in Counts 1 & 3. Court sentences the defendant to: Costs to include DNA surcharge to be paid within 60 days or payment plan.DNA sample to be given.  Appeal Rights Given.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney William Michael Lennon in court.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Lennon requesting a motion hearing date be scheduled. Suppression motion filed earlier today.  Motion hearing scheduled for September 2, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant's Motion to Suppress Fruits of Search of Premises

2:09 pm case called. Defendant Kari E. Geno in court with attorney William Michael Lennon.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.       Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Preliminary Hearing and Time Limits discussed. Defendant wishes to waive preliminary hearing. Court questions defendant and accepts waiver of preliminary hearing, has read the complaint, finds probable cause and enters an order binding the defendant over for trial. Information filed. Attorney Lennon confirms receipt, waives formal reading and enters a plea of Not Guilty.   STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Status conference scheduled for July 31, 2015 at 04:00 pm.

Complete ID process with the Sheriff's Department.  The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.

Case Called @ 1:24 PM: Defendant Kari E. Geno in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Def advised of right to counsel.  Def wants counsel.  Referred to SPD for eligibility.  Off Record for Def to speak with SPD.  Back of Record @  2:08 PM:  Per Def, more info to be provided to SPD for eligibility.  Court orders Signature Bond with conditions.   Should Def be found not eligible for SPD services, Court will appoint counsel with same procedure just noted for Duane Geno - $250 deposit paid up front with $50/mo PP to commence 8/1/2015.  Def states she may explore retaining her own counsel.   IA Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Initial appearance scheduled for June 26, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
